table-wrap.anchoringText: The fluid flow of the study area is simulated using GEM combined with WINPROP from Computer Modeling Group (CMG). WINPROP computes the thermodynamic properties of the reservoir fluid including bubble point pressure, solution gas-oil ratio, formation volume factor, and fluid viscosities (oil and gas). Table 1 shows the fluid and reservoir model parameters. The fluid properties are tuned based on literature (Dicharry et al., 1973; Chaback and Williams, 1988).
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Fluid properties and reservoir model parameters.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Fluid properties and reservoir model parameters.
